An 'iodide' ion is the ion I − . Compounds
with iodine in formal oxidation state −1 are called 'iodides'. This page
is for the iodide ion and its salts, not organoiodine compounds. In everyday
life, iodide is most commonly encountered as a component of iodized salt, which
many governments mandate. Worldwide, iodine deficiency affects two billion
people and is the leading preventable cause of mental retardation.
headings: Structure and characteristics of inorganic iodides
